meanings.definition: To make a written or printed copy of spoken material
meanings.sent1: She transcribed the teacher's words into her notebook.
meanings.sent2: The secretary transcribed the meeting minutes for everyone to read.
meanings.sent3: He transcribed the joke he heard at the party to share with his friends.
meanings.sent4: The artist transcribed the beauty of the sunset onto the canvas.
meanings.sent5: The historian meticulously transcribed the ancient manuscript for future generations to study.

meanings.definition: To convert (data) into a coded form
meanings.sent1: The scientist transcribed the experimental results into a digital format.
meanings.sent2: The encryption software transcribed the sensitive information for security purposes.
meanings.sent3: The spy transcribed the secret message into a complex code to protect it.
meanings.sent4: The computer program transcribed the data into binary for processing.
meanings.sent5: The translator transcribed the document into a secure code for transmission.

meanings.definition: To write out in another alphabet or language
meanings.sent1: She transcribed the poem from English to French for the international audience.
meanings.sent2: The linguist transcribed the ancient text into modern Mandarin for analysis.
meanings.sent3: He transcribed the recipe into Spanish to share with his friends from abroad.
meanings.sent4: The student transcribed the passage into Latin as part of a language exercise.
meanings.sent5: The interpreter transcribed the speech into sign language for the deaf audience.
